required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Night Spectacle Correction Concerning an Improvement of Mesopic Vision Quality
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Night Spectacle Correction Concerning an Improvement of Mesopic Vision Quality

brief_summary.textblock:
Reduced quality of vision and glare in twilight or night are frequently mentioned complaints within the optometric examination. A reason for these problems could be a myopic refractive shift in dark light conditions, commonly known as night myopia or twilight myopia.
The aim of this study was to investigate whether quality of vision in twilight or night could be improved by a spectacle correction optimized for mesopic light conditions. Moreover, objective refraction in large pupils measured by aberrometry was compared to subjective mesopic refraction.

detailed_description.textblock:
After obtaining informed consent, aberrometry was performed in a darkened room (0.1 lux). Subjective photopic refraction and visual acuity were measured before light was turned off and mesopic refraction was obtained after a dark adaptation period of five minutes. Finally, frames and lenses were fitted by a centration system. Lens grinding was executed centralized by a grinding workshop. In the course of this study, subjects were randomly assigned to wear two glasses double-masked in turn. One with photopic subjective refraction data and another with mesopic subjective refraction data. Both were worn for 14 ± 2 days each.
Follow Up 1:
After two weeks, participants were asked for their subjective experiences with the first correction by a visual analogue scale questionnaire. After the evaluation, glasses were changed.
Follow Up 2:
Two weeks later, subjective experiences were evaluated again. After visual analogue scale questionnaire, subjects were asked to compare the two glasses concerning quality of mesopic vision and subjective safety level during night driving.

primary_outcome.description: Value of refractive shift (SE) when changing luminance from a photopic to a mesopic level. At Baseline, participants were not separated into arms as the Randomization Process was carried out at a later time point after participants picked up study glasses. Therefore, data are presented for All Participants in one Arm/Group.

secondary_outcome.description: Difference of visual acuity (monocular and binocular) in a darkened room (0.1 lux) after a dark adaption period of 5 min. with photopic spectacle correction ("classic" refraction obtained in photopic light conditions) compared to mesopic spectacle correction (correction of night myopia) Scale: logMAR visual acuity, using Landolt C optotypes. At Baseline, participants were not separated into arms as the Randomization Process was carried out at a later time point after participants picked up study glasses. Therefore, data are presented for All Participants in one Arm/Group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Vision Comfort in Dark Light Conditions
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective perceived vision comfort with the study and control glasses. Both glasses (study and control glasses) were tested for two weeks each. After the two weeks test, each of the glasses was evaluated. For evaluation a visual analogue scale questionnaire (Scale 0 - 100) was used. Question: How would you evaluate vision comfort with the tested glasses in dark light conditions? Answer: visual analogue scale slider from 0 (insufficient) to 100 (very good)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Vision Sharpness in Dark Light Conditions
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective perceived vision sharpness with the study and control glasses. Both glasses (study and control glasses) were tested for two weeks each. After the two weeks test, each of the glasses was evaluated. For evaluation a visual analogue scale questionnaire (Scale 0 - 100) was used. Question: How would you evaluate vision sharpness with the tested glasses in dark light conditions? Answer: visual analogue scale slider from 0 (insufficient) to 100 (very good)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Glare Sensitivity in Dark Light Conditions
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective perceived glare sensitivity with the study and control glasses. Both glasses (study and control glasses) were tested for two weeks each. After the two weeks test, each of the glasses was evaluated. For evaluation a visual analogue scale questionnaire (Scale 0 - 100) was used. Question: How would you evaluate glare sensitivity with the tested glasses in dark light conditions? Answer: visual analogue scale slider from 0 (no glare) to 100 (strong glare)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective Driving Safety in Dark Light Conditions
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective perceived driving safety sense with the study and control glasses. Both glasses (study and control glasses) were tested for two weeks each. After the two weeks test, each of the glasses was evaluated. For evaluation a visual analogue scale questionnaire (Scale 0 - 100) was used. Question: How would you evaluate driving safety sense when driving in twilight or night with the tested glasses? Answer: visual analogue scale slider from 0 (not safe) to 100 (very safe)

arm_group.description: Refraction for this glasses was obtained at low luminance.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Spectacle Correction for photopic light conditions
arm_group.description: Refraction for this glasses was obtained at high luminance level.

intervention.arm_group_label: Spectacle Correction for photopic light conditions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Visual Acuity at least 0.8 (5/6)
- Binocular Vision
Exclusion Criteria:
- refraction more than sph +/- 6 D and cyl 2 D
- Difference between habitual correction and actual refraction more than 0.5 D
- Medication with an influence on visual system
- Disease or eye disease with an effect on the visual system
- pregnancy or other hormonal variances
- influence of drugs
- mental handicap

group.title: Night Spectacle Correction - Photopic Spectacle Correction
group.description: This arm has tested first the mesopic spectacle correction for 2 weeks and after this time the ("standard") photopic spectacle correction for two weeks Cross Over Design!

group.title: Photopic Spectacle Correction - Night Spectacle Correction
group.description: This arm has tested first the standard photopic spectacle correction for two weeks and after this time the mesopic spectacle correction for two weeks Cross Over Design!

participants_list.participants: test period: 14 days with each test glasses
test period: 14 days with each test glasses

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: All subjects were included in Baseline and all investigations were obtained at these 100 subjects

measure.title: Aberrometry Spherical Equivalent (SE) small pupil OD
measure.description: OD = right eye. Spherical Equivalent was calculated with data of an aberrometer (VISIONIX VX120 family). Spherical Equivalent is calculated by (sph + 0.5*cyl).

measure.title: Aberrometry SE at small pupil OS
measure.description: SE = Spherical Equivalent. OS = left eye. Spherical Equivalent was calculated with data of an aberrometer (VISIONIX VX120 family). Spherical Equivalent is calculated by (sph + 0.5*cyl).

measure.title: Subjective photopic Refraction SE OD
measure.description: SE = Spherical Equivalent OD = Right Eye Subjective Refraction measured in a photopic luminance level (comparable to an eye examination for new glasses). Spherical Equivalent was calculated with data of subjective refraction. Spherical Equivalent is calculated by (sph + 0.5*cyl).

measure.title: Subjective photopic Refraction SE OS
measure.description: SE = Spherical Equivalent OS = Left Eye Subjective Refraction measured in a photopic luminance level (comparable to an eye examination for new glasses). Subjective Refraction measured in a photopic luminance level. Spherical Equivalent was calculated with data of subjective refraction. Spherical Equivalent is calculated by (sph + 0.5*cyl).

measure.title: Photopic Visual Acuity OD
measure.description: Best Corrected Visual Acuity in a photopic luminance. OD = Right Eye 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Photopic Visual Acuity OS
measure.description: Best Corrected Visual Acuity in a photopic luminance OS = Left Eye. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc

measure.title: Binocular photopic Visual Acuity
measure.description: Best Corrected Visual Acuity in a photopic luminance, binocular. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity with photopic refraction OD
measure.description: Visual Acuity measured in a mesopic luminance, wearing refraction values measured in photopic luminance OD = Right Eye. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity with photopic refraction OS
measure.description: Visual Acuity measured in a mesopic luminance, wearing refraction values measured in photopic luminance OS = Left Eye. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity with photopic refraction Binocular
measure.description: Visual Acuity measured in a mesopic luminance, wearing refraction values measured in photopic luminance Binocular. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Subjective Mesopic Refraction SE OD
measure.description: Mesopic Refraction measured in mesopic luminance (comparable to an eye examination for new glasses in a darkened room). OD = Right Eye SE = Spherical Equivalent

measure.title: Subjective Mesopic Refraction SE OS
measure.description: Mesopic Refraction measured in mesopic luminance (comparable to an eye examination for new glasses in a darkened room). OS = Right Eye SE = Spherical Equivalent

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity with Mesopic Refraction OD
measure.description: Best corrected visual acuity after refraction in mesopic luminance OD = Right Eye. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity with Mesopic Refraction OS
measure.description: Best corrected visual acuity after refraction in mesopic luminance OS = Left Eye. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity with Mesopic Refraction Binocular
measure.description: Best corrected visual acuity after refraction in mesopic luminance Binocular. 0.0 corresponds to a Snellen Visual Acuity 20/20, 0.1 to 20/25, 0.2 to 20/32, -0.1 to 20/16, etc.

measure.title: Spherical Aberration OD
measure.description: Measured by Aberrometry OD = Right Eye

measure.title: Spherical Aberration OS
measure.description: Measured by Aberrometry OS = Left Eye

measure.title: Max. pupil size aberrometry OD
measure.description: measured by aberrometry OD = Right Eye

measure.title: Max. pupil size aberrometry OS
measure.description: measured by aberrometry OS = Left Eye

measure.title: Aberrometry Spherical Equivalent (SE) large pupil OD
measure.description: OD = Right Eye. Spherical Equivalent was calculated with data of an aberrometer (VISIONIX VX120 family). Spherical Equivalent is calculated by (sph + 0.5*cyl). SE value of max. pupil size.

measure.title: Aberrometry Spherical Equivalent (SE) large pupil OS
measure.description: OS = Left Eye. Spherical Equivalent was calculated with data of an aberrometer (VISIONIX VX120 family). Spherical Equivalent is calculated by (sph + 0.5*cyl). SE value of max. pupil size.

measure.title: Pupil size in photopic light conditions OD
measure.description: Measured by Infra Red Camera in photopic conditions OD = Right Eye

measure.title: Pupil size in photopic light conditions OS
measure.description: Measured by Infra Red Camera in photooic conditions. OS = Left Eye

measure.description: Measured by Infra Red Camera in mesopic conditions. OD = Right Eye

measure.title: Pupil size in mesopic light conditions OS
measure.description: Measured by Infra Red Camera in mesopic conditions OS = Left Eye

measure.description: J0 = Astigmatism component Calculated after performing cross-cylinder method in a darkened room OD = Right Eye

outcome.title: Night Myopia
outcome.description: Value of refractive shift (SE) when changing luminance from a photopic to a mesopic level. At Baseline, participants were not separated into arms as the Randomization Process was carried out at a later time point after participants picked up study glasses. Therefore, data are presented for All Participants in one Arm/Group.

measure.title: Night Myopia
measure.description: Value of refractive shift (SE) when changing luminance from a photopic to a mesopic level. At Baseline, participants were not separated into arms as the Randomization Process was carried out at a later time point after participants picked up study glasses. Therefore, data are presented for All Participants in one Arm/Group.

outcome.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity Improvement
outcome.description: Difference of visual acuity (monocular and binocular) in a darkened room (0.1 lux) after a dark adaption period of 5 min. with photopic spectacle correction ("classic" refraction obtained in photopic light conditions) compared to mesopic spectacle correction (correction of night myopia) Scale: logMAR visual acuity, using Landolt C optotypes. At Baseline, participants were not separated into arms as the Randomization Process was carried out at a later time point after participants picked up study glasses. Therefore, data are presented for All Participants in one Arm/Group.

measure.title: Mesopic Visual Acuity Improvement
measure.description: Difference of visual acuity (monocular and binocular) in a darkened room (0.1 lux) after a dark adaption period of 5 min. with photopic spectacle correction ("classic" refraction obtained in photopic light conditions) compared to mesopic spectacle correction (correction of night myopia) Scale: logMAR visual acuity, using Landolt C optotypes. At Baseline, participants were not separated into arms as the Randomization Process was carried out at a later time point after participants picked up study glasses. Therefore, data are presented for All Participants in one Arm/Group.

outcome.title: Subjective Vision Comfort in Dark Light Conditions
outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective perceived vision comfort with the study and control glasses. Both glasses (study and control glasses) were tested for two weeks each. After the two weeks test, each of the glasses was evaluated. For evaluation a visual analogue scale questionnaire (Scale 0 - 100) was used. Question: How would you evaluate vision comfort with the tested glasses in dark light conditions? Answer: visual analogue scale slider from 0 (insufficient) to 100 (very good)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
